sen.e: "Lemon" is a story by Motojiro KAJII.

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）、中谷孝雄、外村繁らとの同人誌「青空」の創刊号の巻頭に掲載された。
sen.e: The story appeared in 1925 at the top of the first issue of "Aozora" a dojinshi (publication sold directly and not via commercial publishers) that Kajii published with Takao NAKATANI and Shigeru TONOMURA.

sen.j: その後、梶井の友人である三好達治らの奔走により、亡くなる一年ほど前（1931年）に武蔵野書院より作品集として刊行された。
sen.e: Later, with efforts of his friends such as Tatsuji MIYOSHI, a collection of Kajii's stories entitled "Lemon" was published by Musashinoshoin in 1931, a year prior to his death.

sen.j: 肺を病んだ「私」は得体の知れない不安に始終苛まれ、それまで関心を持っていた音楽や詩、文具店の丸善への興味を失い、当てもなくさまよい歩く。
sen.e: The protagonist had a lung disease and always suffered from strange anxiety, so he lost interest in music, poems, and his favorite stationary store Maruzen, and was wondering around the city.

The protagonist has lung disease and always suffers from an illogical anxiety, and losing interest in the things he used to enjoy, such as music, poems, and his favorite stationery store Maruzen, we find him wandering aimlessly around the city.

I,' the protagonist, had lung disease and always suffered from an illogical anxiety, and losing interest in the things 'I' used to enjoy, such as music, poems, and 'my' favorite stationery store Maruzen, then wandering aimlessly around the city.

sen.j: そんな折り、普段から気に入っていた寺町通の果物屋（京都市中京区「八百卯」・2009年1月25日閉店）の前で「私」はふと足を止める。
sen.e: One day, the protagonist happened to stop in front of a fruit store on Teramachi-dori Street that he frequented (the store was "Yaou" in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, went out of business in January 25, 2009).

sen.j: そこには珍しく、檸檬が並べてあったのだった。
sen.e: There were lemons that rarely found at that time.
There he finds lemons for sale, a rare sight.

sen.j: 「私」は気に入ってそのレモンを一つ買ったが、肺病で熱を帯びた手にその果実の冷たさはちょうど良く、それまでの不安が幾分か和むのに気がつく。
sen.e: The protagonist liked it and bought a lemon, the cold texture of the fruit was comfortable for his feverish hand and he found that his anxiety was somewhat diminished.
The protagonist eagerly buys a lemon, finding the cold texture of the fruit comfortable for his feverish hand and his anxiety somewhat diminished.

sen.j: そしてそのまま、足が遠ざかっていた丸善に立ち寄るが、「私」はまた不安な気持ちにさせられる。
sen.e: Then he stopped by Maruzen where he had not visited for a while, but the store made him uneasy again.

sen.j: 普段気に入って見ていた画集を見てもその気持ちが変わらないのに不満を覚えた「私」は、画集を積み上げたうえに時限爆弾に見立ててレモンを置いて立ち去る。
sen.e: He looked through books of paintings that he used to loved but his uneasiness didn't disappear, so, with his frustration, he left the lemon on the pile of books imagining that the lemon was a bomb.
He looks through books of paintings that he used to love but he can't shake the feeling of unease, so feeling frustrated he places the lemon on a pile of books imagining the lemon to be a bomb.

sen.e: After that, the protagonist imagined how things that made him uneasy were exploded by the lemon bomb and excited by himself.

sen.j: 病人の心情や、人間の誰もが抱くいたずらな感情を描写した作品。
sen.e: The story depicts feelings of a sick person and a mischievous desire that anyone has.

sen.e: As a tubercular patient himself (and died young because of illness), many of protagonists in Kajii's stories had a lung disease.
